intro: Tetrastigma micranthum, commonly known as the small-flowered cross-vine, is a climbing plant belonging to the grape family, Vitaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its twining stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically green when mature. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
